meanings.definition: planographies: a method of printing from a flat surface treated so as to repel the ink except where it is required for printing.
meanings.sent1: The artist used planographies to create unique prints.
meanings.sent2: I learned about planographies in my art class.
meanings.sent3: The planographies seemed to dance on the paper as they were printed.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a canvas, the planographies of her thoughts coming to life.
meanings.sent5: The planographies on the wall told a story of creativity and precision.

meanings.definition: planographies: a print made using the planographic process.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed beautiful planographies from famous artists.
meanings.sent2: I bought a planographies print to decorate my room.
meanings.sent3: The planographies print looked like a snapshot frozen in time.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like planographies, vivid and detailed.
meanings.sent5: The planographies captured the essence of the scene with remarkable clarity.
